QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Histiocyte
QAPair.Answer: Macrophages do not travel through the blood. Instead, they remain in one part of the body. Macrophages are found in many organs and tissues, including the: Brain, Breast tissue, Liver, Lung, Lymph nodes, Placenta, Spleen, Tonsils, In people with a disease called Langerhans cell histiocytosis (previously called histiocytosis X ), there is an excess of macrophages and other white blood cells in some bodily tissues.
